description: Common schema definitions for divisions theme

placetype.description: Category of the division from a finite, hierarchical, ordered list of categories (e.g. country, region, locality, etc.) similar to a Who's on First placetype.

hierarchy.description:
A hierarchy of divisions, with the first entry being a country; each subsequent entry, if any, being a division that is a direct child of the previous entry; and the last entry representing the division that contains the hierarchy.
For example, a hierarchy for the United States is simply [United States]. A hierarchy for the U.S. state of New Hampshire would be [United States, New Hampshire], and a hierarchy for the city of Concord, NH would be [United States, New Hampshire, Merrimack County, Concord].

perspective.description: A political perspective from which the division is viewed

type.description:
Type of perspective
If the perspective is of type 'country', then the 'holder' property must be an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code identifying the country that holds this perspective.

boundarySideDivision.description: Represents a division on one side or the other of a boundary line, along with that division's stance on whether or not it disputes the boundary.

is_disputing.description: Whether the division disputes the boundary location. If this property is omitted, the division's dispute status is unknown, but for many applications it will be safe to assume there is no dispute.
